initial_story:
The baby suffered a cardiac arrest at the theme park on Thursday

A woman has been arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park.

The baby is in a critical condition in hospital following the incident at Legoland Windsor at about 13:00 BST on Thursday, police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child to cause unnecessary injury.

She has been released on bail until 26 July.

Det Con Zoe Eele, of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "Firstly, our thoughts are with the family of the boy who is in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

Police said they are not looking for further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.
stories:
The 10-year-old boy suffered a severe allergic reaction at the water park on Saturday

A man has been arrested on suspicion of recklessly endangering a young boy who suffered a severe allergic reaction at a water park.

The boy is in a stable condition in hospital following the incident at SplashWorld Waterpark at about 14:30 BST on Saturday, authorities said.

A 35-year-old man from nearby city, was arrested on suspicion of recklessly endangering a child to cause unnecessary harm.

He has been released on bail until 31 August.

Det Insp James Lee, of the Local Police Department, said: "Our thoughts are with the boy and his family, and we are working closely with the team at SplashWorld Waterpark to understand the circumstances surrounding the incident.

"We are appealing for anyone who was in the area around the wave pool between 13:00 and 14:00 to come forward with any information they may have. We are also urging people not to speculate about the incident and to respect the boy's family during this difficult time."
A 12-year-old girl was rushed to the hospital after collapsing at the school's annual talent show.
A 17-year-old boy was whisked away to the recording studio after his impromptu guitar solo stunned the crowd at the town's annual music festival.
A 22-year-old painter was summoned to the prestigious art gallery after her spontaneous mural on the city's historic wall mesmerized passersby during the summer solstice celebration.
A 25-year-old musician was invited to perform at the legendary jazz club after her impromptu concert on the city's rooftop during the autumn equinox festival brought the crowd to its feet.

A 30-year-old chef was asked to cater a private dinner party for a reclusive tech mogul after her innovative, farm-to-table pop-up dinner during the summer solstice celebration left the attendees in awe of her culinary skills.

A 25-year-old photographer was commissioned to capture the essence of a nomadic tribe's ancient rituals after her breathtaking, black-and-white portrait series of the tribe's elder during the spring equinox ceremony left the art world abuzz with her unique perspective.

A 32-year-old chef was invited to prepare a bespoke dinner for a reclusive billionaire after his innovative, avant-garde cookbook featuring molecular gastronomy recipes inspired by the Amazonian rainforest left the culinary world agog with his unorthodox approach.

A 27-year-old jazz musician was commissioned to compose an exclusive soundtrack for a enigmatic film director after his boundary-pushing, electro-acoustic album inspired by the neon-lit streets of Tokyo left the music industry abuzz with his fearless experimentation.

A 32-year-old avant-garde choreographer was approached by a visionary fashion designer to create a groundbreaking dance piece for her debut couture collection after her provocative, multimedia performance art project inspired by the avant-garde architecture of Berlin's Kreuzberg district electrified the art world with her unbridled creativity.

A 28-year-old neuroscientist was approached by a pioneering game developer to design a revolutionary virtual reality experience for her debut escape room after her innovative, data-driven research on the neural basis of spatial cognition inspired by the futuristic architecture of Tokyo's Shibuya district captivated the scientific community with her unwavering curiosity.

A 32-year-old environmental engineer was approached by a visionary fashion designer to create a sustainable, futuristic textile inspired by the majestic beauty of the Amazon rainforest's bioluminescent organisms, which had caught the attention of the scientific community with her groundbreaking research on the application of biomimicry in textile production, fueled by her insatiable curiosity about the intricate relationships between nature and human innovation.

A 27-year-old neuroscientist was approached by a pioneering architect to design a smart, adaptive building material inspired by the extraordinary cognitive abilities of the octopus, which had fascinated the scientific community with its unparalleled problem-solving skills, fueled by its insatiable curiosity about its underwater environment and its ability to manipulate its surroundings through sheer intelligence and adaptability.

A 35-year-old botanist was approached by a visionary fashion designer to develop a dynamic, responsive textile inspired by the remarkable adaptability of the praying mantis, which had captivated the scientific world with its uncanny ability to camouflage itself in its forest surroundings, fueled by its innate curiosity about its environment and its capacity to subtly adjust its physical appearance to blend seamlessly with its surroundings.

A 25-year-old architect was approached by a pioneering urban planner to design a futuristic cityscape inspired by the intricate social networks of the African honey bee, which had fascinated the scientific community with its remarkable ability to communicate and collaborate to build complex structures, fueled by its innate desire for community and its capacity to adapt its organization to optimize resource allocation.

A 30-year-old biotechnologist was approached by a visionary entrepreneur to develop a revolutionary wearable device inspired by the remarkable navigation abilities of the desert-dwelling antelope, which had captivated the scientific community with its ability to adapt its migratory patterns to changing environmental conditions, fueled by its innate desire for survival and its capacity to optimize energy consumption.

A 25-year-old marine biologist was commissioned by a pioneering environmentalist to design an innovative underwater listening device modeled after the extraordinary acoustic abilities of the deep-sea anglerfish, which had fascinated the scientific world with its capacity to detect faint sounds and subtle vibrations in the dark abyss, driven by its primal need to locate prey and avoid predators, and its remarkable ability to conserve energy by amplifying sound waves through its bioluminescent lure.

A 30-year-old astronomer was tasked by a renowned astrophysicist to develop an unprecedented space-based resonance detector inspired by the remarkable celestial harmonics of a distant binary star system, which had captivated the scientific community with its ability to generate eerie, synchronized oscillations in the vacuum of space, driven by the gravitational dance of its two companion stars, and its extraordinary capacity to harness energy from the cosmic wind by tuning into the subtle vibrations of the universe.

A 25-year-old biotechnologist was commissioned by a pioneering geneticist to design a revolutionary bio-sensing device inspired by the astonishing molecular symphony of a specific species of hummingbirds, which had fascinated scientists with its ability to generate mesmerizing, synchronized hums in the heart of the Amazon rainforest, driven by the intricate dance of its iridescent feathers and extraordinary capacity to harness energy from the sun by tuning into the subtle vibrations of the forest's ecosystem.

A 32-year-old astrophysicist was recruited by a visionary astronomer to develop a groundbreaking gravitational wave detector modeled after the entrancing celestial ballet of a distant binary star system, whose orbiting partners had captivated scientists with their synchronized waltz, generated by the delicate interplay of their gravitational forces and exquisite resonance with the cosmic rhythms of the galaxy.

A 25-year-old marine biologist was entrusted by a pioneering oceanographer to design a revolutionary underwater observatory inspired by the mesmerizing courtship displays of a tropical fish species, whose intricate dance patterns had long fascinated researchers with their precision choreography, orchestrated by the subtle interplay of light, sound, and currents in the ocean's rhythmical heartbeat.

As a renowned astronomer, a 32-year-old astrophysicist was tasked by a visionary planetary scientist to conceptualize a groundbreaking lunar habitat inspired by the entrancing bioluminescent displays of a deep-sea jellyfish species, whose ethereal glow had long captivated explorers with its pulsing rhythms, orchestrated by the symbiotic harmony of microbial life, ocean currents, and the moon's gentle gravitational pulse.

As a visionary botanist, a 35-year-old horticulturist was entrusted by a celebrated ecological engineer to design a revolutionary arboreal sanctuary inspired by the mesmerizing iridescent colors of a rare, tropical butterfly species, whose shimmering wings had long fascinated naturalists with its intricate patterns, orchestrated by the synchronicity of temperature fluctuations, humidity levels, and the gentle rustle of leaves in the forest's morning breeze.

As a master of luminescent artistry, a 28-year-old glassblower was commissioned by a renowned architect to craft an ethereal, aquatic sanctuary inspired by the captivating bioluminescence of a newly discovered, deep-sea jellyfish species, whose glowing tendrils had long mesmerized marine biologists with its hypnotic rhythms, orchestrated by the harmony of ocean currents, water pressure, and the soft lapping of waves against the seashore.

As a weaver of sonic tapestries, a 35-year-old sound designer was hired by a visionary choreographer to create an otherworldly, aerial ballet inspired by the haunting, metallic whispers of a recently discovered, high-altitude wind harp, whose ethereal strings had long fascinated aeronautical engineers with its eerie melodies, orchestrated by the harmony of jet streams, thermal currents, and the distant rumble of thunderstorms.

As a cartographer of celestial cartouches, a 25-year-old astronomer was commissioned by a charismatic director to craft a luminescent, orbital opera inspired by the enigmatic, luminescent aurora borealis, whose shimmering curtains of light had long captivated planetary scientists with its hypnotic rhythms, orchestrated by the symphony of solar flares, geomagnetic pulses, and the soft glow of distant nebulae.

As a weaver of sonic tapestries, a 30-year-old composer was tasked by a visionary producer to create a haunting, electroacoustic requiem inspired by the mesmerizing, iridescent bioluminescence of the deep-sea anglerfish, whose ethereal, luminescent lures had long fascinated marine biologists with its haunting melodies, orchestrated by the symphony of oceanic currents, whale songs, and the soft glow of coral reefs.

As a cartographer of celestial topographies, a 40-year-old astronomer was commissioned by a pioneering astrophysicist to craft a sweeping, electroacoustic odyssey inspired by the enigmatic, cosmic dust trails of the Andromeda galaxy, whose shimmering, stardust pathways had captivated astrophotographers with its haunting harmonies, orchestrated by the celestial ballet of black holes, supernovae, and the soft pulse of distant neutron stars.

As a weaver of sonic tapestries, a 35-year-old sound designer was approached by a visionary composer to create a haunting, aural tapestry inspired by the mystical, auroral currents of the aurora borealis, whose shimmering, ethereal wisps had entranced sound artists with its haunting melodies, orchestrated by the celestial ballet of solar flares, coronal mass ejections, and the soft whisper of distant comets.

As a painter of luminous hues, a 28-year-old chroma artist was commissioned by a pioneering light sculptor to craft a kaleidoscopic canvas infused with the iridescent, spectral essence of the iridium-iridescent clouds of the noctilucent cirrus, whose shimmering, iridescent tendrils had mesmerized light artists with its radiant, luminescent hues, orchestrated by the celestial waltz of lunar phases, solar eclipses, and the soft glow of distant starbursts.

As a composer of sonic tapestries, a 32-year-old sound weaver was commissioned by a visionary acoustic architect to craft a synesthetic soundscape that harmonized the luminescent resonance of the aurora borealis, whose ethereal, shimmering curtains had captivated sound artists with its celestial melodies, orchestrated by the rhythmic pulse of planetary alignments, solar flares, and the whispered secrets of the cosmic wind.

As a painter of chromatic narratives, a 27-year-old color whisperer was commissioned by a pioneering light sculptor to craft a visceral fresco that resonated with the luminescent vibrations of a thousand midsummer dawns, whose kaleidoscopic, swirling patterns had mesmerized visual artists with its terrestrial symphonies, orchestrated by the rhythmic pulse of ancient ley lines, lunar cycles, and the whispered secrets of the earth's heartbeat.

As a weaver of sonic tapestries, a 35-year-old sound sorceress was tasked by a visionary composer to create a haunting melody that echoed with the ethereal harmonies of a thousand autumn evenings, whose shimmering, iridescent auras had captivated musicians with its celestial symphonies, orchestrated by the celestial rhythms of planetary alignments, solar flares, and the whispered mysteries of the cosmos' pulse.

As a master of chromatic whispers, a 27-year-old sonic architect was commissioned by a luminary poet to craft a mesmerizing odyssey that resonated with the whispered secrets of forgotten libraries, whose dusty, yellowed tomes had bewitched scholars with their ancient incantations, scripted by the celestial ballet of shooting stars, lunar eclipses, and the cryptic rhythms of a forgotten city's heartbeat.

As a weaver of aural tapestries, a 35-year-old sonic cartographer was tasked by a visionary composer to forge a dreamlike pilgrimage that harmonized with the murmurs of abandoned clock towers, whose worn, ivy-covered faces had entranced townsfolk with their mechanical lullabies, scripted by the celestial choreography of solar flares, aurora borealis, and the haunting melodies of a forgotten river's whispered lament.

As a master of luminescent cartography, a 30-year-old cartomancer was commissioned by a mystical cartographer to chart a metaphysical odyssey that synchronized with the whispers of ancient, crumbling libraries, whose worn, leather-bound spines had bewitched scholars with their forgotten incantations, scripted by the celestial geometry of moon phases, the soft glow of luminescent fungi, and the haunting melodies of a long-silent piano's ghostly reverberations.

As a keeper of auroral chronicles, a 40-year-old chronoarchivist was entrusted by a mystical chronologist to chronicle an astral pilgrimage that harmonized with the murmurs of antique, gemstone-encrusted astrolabes, whose ornate, ivory-inlaid dials had mesmerized astronomers with their cryptic, sidereal equations, inscribed by the celestial ballet of comets, the soft shimmer of iridescent butterflies, and the mournful echoes of a long-forgotten lyre's ghostly vibrations.

As a weaver of lunar tapestries, a 30-year-old cosmographer was commissioned by an enigmatic cartographer to cartograph an ethereal odyssey that resonated with the whispers of antique, gemstone-studded celestial spheres, whose intricate, mother-of-pearl inlays had captivated geographers with their enigmatic, astronomical riddles, inscribed by the terrestrial waltz of migrating birds, the gentle glow of luminescent fireflies, and the haunting melodies of a forgotten flute's spectral sighs.

As a painter of sonic landscapes, a 35-year-old sound cartographer was entrusted by a reclusive musicologist to sonify an ephemeral journey that harmonized with the whispers of ancient, gemstone-encrusted lyres, whose intricate, opaline inlays had fascinated acousticians with their enigmatic, aural puzzles, inscribed by the terrestrial waltz of rustling leaves, the soft hum of luminescent bees, and the mournful echoes of a forgotten cello's lamenting sighs.

As a weaver of nocturnal tapestries, a 40-year-old astronomer was commissioned by a secretive astrologer to chart the celestial cartography of a dreamlike odyssey that resonated with the whispers of ancient, stardust-encrusted lyres, whose intricate, aurora-like inlays had captivated cosmologists with their mysterious, gravitational harmonies, inscribed by the gentle rustle of shooting stars, the soft murmur of lunar whispers, and the haunting melodies of a forgotten comet's lullaby sighs.

As a chronologist of abandoned chronicles, a 40-year-old astronomer was commissioned by a secretive horologist to unravel the cryptic cartography of a celestial metropolis, whose ethereal, starlight-etched spires had mesmerized stargazers with their enigmatic, celestial harmonics, inscribed by the whispers of ancient, celestial maps, the soft glow of luminescent astrocharts, and the haunting whispers of a forgotten astronomer's final, unfinished theories.

As a cartographer of forgotten libraries, a 30-year-old linguist was entrusted by a reclusive cryptologist to decipher the cryptic codex of a subterranean metropolis, whose ancient, parchment-creased texts had captivated scholars with their enigmatic, linguistic harmonies, inscribed by the whispers of long-lost, linguistic cartographers, the flickering glow of luminescent lexicons, and the haunting whispers of a forgotten linguist's final, unfinished theses.

As a keeper of forgotten melodies, a 27-year-old composer was approached by a reclusive sound designer to decipher the enigmatic harmonies of a submerged metropolis, whose weathered, salt-encrusted instruments had captivated musicians with their cryptic, sonorous vibrations, inscribed by the whispers of lost, musical cartographers, the soft glow of flickering gramophones, and the echoes of a forgotten composer's last, unfinished symphonies.

As a curator of lost narratives, a 35-year-old journalist was commissioned by a mysterious storyteller to unravel the enigmatic chronicles of a hidden library, whose weathered, leather-bound tomes had mesmerized readers with their cryptic, hieroglyphic scripts, inscribed by the whispers of forgotten, literary cartographers, the soft glow of flickering lanterns, and the echoes of a forgotten author's last, unfinished novels.

As a cartographer of forgotten melodies, a 27-year-old musician was entrusted by a cryptic composer to decipher the ethereal scores of a hidden conservatory, whose dusty, sheet music-encased cabinets had captivated listeners with their haunting, Morse code-like notations, inscribed by the whispers of forgotten, sonic architects, the warm glow of crackling fireplaces, and the echoes of a forgotten singer's last, unfinished arias.

As a custodian of abandoned libraries, a 35-year-old bibliophile was tasked by a reclusive author to unravel the cryptic tomes of a hidden scriptorium, whose weathered, parchment-bound volumes had mesmerized scholars with their ancient, hieroglyphic-like inscriptions, penned by the whispers of forgotten, scribes, the soft hum of oil lamps, and the murmurs of a forgotten poet's last, unfinished sonnets.

As a curator of forgotten gardens, a 40-year-old botanist was entrusted by a mysterious horticulturist to decipher the cryptic blooms of a hidden conservatory, whose weathered, terracotta-pot-bound flora had captivated naturalists with their exotic, hieroglyphic-like markings, inscribed by the whispers of forgotten, gardeners, the soft glow of lanterns, and the murmurs of a forgotten composer's last, unfinished symphonies.

As a keeper of ancient melodies, a 60-year-old composer was tasked by a reclusive maestro to unravel the enigmatic harmonies of a secluded music room, whose dusty, wooden-cabinet-bound scores had mesmerized musicians with their intricate, aleatoric-like notations, inscribed by the whispers of forgotten, virtuosos, the soft glow of candles, and the murmurs of a forgotten poet's last, unfinished sonnets.
